avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches are hardly possible in gullies and bowls.

snowpackStructure.comment: The old snowpack is expansively metamorphosed, with a loosely-packed surface with surface hoar and faceted crystals. Very little snow on the ground. Hardly any snow on the ground below 1600m regionally.

tendency.highlights: No significant change expected in avalanche danger levels

weatherForecast.comment: In Upper Carinthia, only occasional minor showers possible. A storm-strength SW wind is blowing over ridgelines and summits. At 2000m: -2 degrees; at 3000m: -3 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: Fresh and older snowdrift accumulations are generally small-sized, triggerable only in isolated cases, esp.on wind-protected shady slopes at high altitudes, esp. in transitions into gullies and bowls and at the foot of rocky cliffs and behind protruberances in the landscape. These danger zones occur seldom. Apart from the risks of being buried in snow masses, the danger of being swept along and forced to take a fall require consideration.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated danger zones in gullies and bowls

snowpackStructure.comment: Only a small amount of fresh snow was registered. Accompanied by strong to storm-strength SW winds, fresh snowdrifts will accumulate further, the drifts will be deposited atop weak layers. The snowpack is expansively metamorphosed, and is highly diverse even over small areas. There is only little snow on the ground. Below 1600m there is hardly any snow on the ground regionally.

tendency.highlights: Increasing avalanche danger due to fresh snow and wind

weatherForecast.comment: In Upper Carinthia, only occasional minor showers possible. In Lower Carinthia, low-lying clouds can disperse, it will remain free of precipitation. A storm-strength SW wind is blowing over ridgelines and summits. At 2000m: -2 degrees; at 3000m: -3 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: As a result of strong-to-stormy SW winds, often trigger-sensitive snowdrift accumulations are being generated during the course of the day in ridgeline terrain, in gullies and bowls and in general above 2400m. These drifts can often be triggered by one sole skier. Releases tend to be small-sized. Apart from the risks of being buried in snow masses, the danger of taking a fall and being swept along also require consideration.

snowpackStructure.comment: Only a small amount of fresh snow was registered. Accompanied by strong to storm-strength SW winds, fresh snowdrifts will accumulate further. Shady slopes: the drifts will be deposited atop weak layers. The snowpack is expansively metamorphosed, and is highly diverse even over small areas. There is only little snow on the ground.

tendency.highlights: Increasing avalanche danger due to fresh snow and wind

weatherForecast.comment: In Upper Carinthia, only occasional minor showers possible. A storm-strength SW wind is blowing over ridgelines and summits. At 2000m: -2 degrees; at 3000m: -3 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: As a result of strong-to-stormy SW winds, often trigger-sensitive snowdrift accumulations are being generated during the course of the day in ridgeline terrain, in gullies and bowls and in general above 2400m. These drifts can often be triggered by one sole skier. Releases tend to be small-sized. Apart from the risks of being buried in snow masses, the danger of taking a fall and being swept along also require consideration.

snowpackStructure.comment: Only a small amount of fresh snow was registered. Up to 10 cm of fresh snow is expected from place to place. Accompanied by strong to storm-strength SW winds, fresh snowdrifts will accumulate further. Shady slopes: the drifts will be deposited atop weak layers. The snowpack is expansively metamorphosed, and is highly diverse even over small areas. There is only little snow on the ground. Below 1600m there is hardly any snow on the ground regionally.

tendency.highlights: Increasing avalanche danger due to fresh snow and wind

weatherForecast.comment: On Monday, a southwesterly air current will accumulate barrier clouds in the Carnic Alps, rainfally and a bit of snowfall can be expected from the clouds. Snowfall level at 1200m, visibility poor. A storm-strength SW wind will be blowing over the ridges and summits. At 2000m: -2 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria
